hints.title: Conditional Velocity Distribution - Multivariate Gaussian (Geometric Gas)
hints.content:
42: :label: lem-conditional-multivariate-gaussian-geometric
43: 
44: For the QSD $\pi_N$ of the Geometric Gas, the conditional distribution of velocities given positions is a **multivariate Gaussian** (not a product):
45: 
46: $$
47: \pi_N(\mathbf{v} | \mathbf{x}) = \mathcal{N}(0, \Sigma_{\mathbf{v}}(\mathbf{x}))
48: $$
49: 
50: where the covariance matrix $\Sigma_{\mathbf{v}}(\mathbf{x}) \in \mathbb{R}^{3N \times 3N}$ is the solution to the continuous Lyapunov equation:
51: 
52: $$
53: A(\mathbf{x}) \Sigma_{\mathbf{v}}(\mathbf{x}) + \Sigma_{\mathbf{v}}(\mathbf{x}) A(\mathbf{x})^T = B(\mathbf{x}) B(\mathbf{x})^T
54: $$
55: 
56: where:

hints.raw_directive:
39: ### 2.1. Multivariate Gaussian Structure
40: 
41: :::{prf:lemma} Conditional Velocity Distribution - Multivariate Gaussian (Geometric Gas)
42: :label: lem-conditional-multivariate-gaussian-geometric
43: 
44: For the QSD $\pi_N$ of the Geometric Gas, the conditional distribution of velocities given positions is a **multivariate Gaussian** (not a product):
45: 
46: $$
47: \pi_N(\mathbf{v} | \mathbf{x}) = \mathcal{N}(0, \Sigma_{\mathbf{v}}(\mathbf{x}))
48: $$
49: 
50: where the covariance matrix $\Sigma_{\mathbf{v}}(\mathbf{x}) \in \mathbb{R}^{3N \times 3N}$ is the solution to the continuous Lyapunov equation:
51: 
52: $$
53: A(\mathbf{x}) \Sigma_{\mathbf{v}}(\mathbf{x}) + \Sigma_{\mathbf{v}}(\mathbf{x}) A(\mathbf{x})^T = B(\mathbf{x}) B(\mathbf{x})^T
54: $$
55: 
56: where:
57: - $A(\mathbf{x}) = \gamma I_{3N} + \nu \mathcal{L}_{\text{norm}}(\mathbf{x}) \otimes I_3$ is the drift matrix (friction + viscous coupling)

hints.label: proof-lem-conditional-multivariate-gaussian-geometric
hints.content:
61: :::{prf:proof}
62: :label: proof-lem-conditional-multivariate-gaussian-geometric
63: Consider the velocity dynamics with positions fixed at $\mathbf{x}$. In vector form with $\mathbf{V} = (v_1, \ldots, v_N) \in \mathbb{R}^{3N}$:
64: 
65: $$
66: d\mathbf{V} = -A(\mathbf{x}) \mathbf{V} \, dt + B(\mathbf{x}) d\mathbf{W}
67: $$
68: 
69: **Structure of $A(\mathbf{x})$:**
70: The drift matrix has the form:
71: 
72: $$
73: A(\mathbf{x}) = \gamma I_{3N} + \nu \mathcal{L}_{\text{norm}}(\mathbf{x}) \otimes I_3
74: $$
75: 
76: where:
77: - $\gamma I_{3N}$ is friction (scalar times identity)
78: - $\mathcal{L}_{\text{norm}}(\mathbf{x})$ is the normalized graph Laplacian: $\mathcal{L}_{\text{norm},ij} = \delta_{ij} - K(x_i-x_j)/\deg(i)$ for $i \neq j$
79: - $\otimes I_3$ indicates the Laplacian acts on particle indices, with each velocity component treated identically
80: 
81: **Structure of $B(\mathbf{x})$:**
82: The noise matrix is block diagonal:
83: 
84: $$
85: B(\mathbf{x}) = \begin{pmatrix}
86: \Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_1, \mathbf{x}) & 0 & \cdots & 0 \\
87: 0 & \Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_2, \mathbf{x}) & \cdots & 0 \\
88: \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\
89: 0 & 0 & \cdots & \Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_N, \mathbf{x})
90: \end{pmatrix}
91: $$
92: 
93: **Stationary distribution:**
94: This is a linear SDE with constant coefficients (for fixed $\mathbf{x}$). The stationary distribution is Gaussian $\mathcal{N}(0, \Sigma_{\mathbf{v}}(\mathbf{x}))$ where the covariance solves the continuous Lyapunov equation (standard result from stochastic analysis):
95: 
96: $$
97: A(\mathbf{x}) \Sigma_{\mathbf{v}}(\mathbf{x}) + \Sigma_{\mathbf{v}}(\mathbf{x}) A(\mathbf{x})^T = B(\mathbf{x}) B(\mathbf{x})^T
98: $$
